meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with nails again.
meanings.sent1: He renailed the loose board to the floor.
meanings.sent2: She renailed the picture frame to the wall.
meanings.sent3: The carpenter renailed the squeaky step, but it still made noise.
meanings.sent4: She renailed her commitment to her goals, determined to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The repairman renailed the shingles, ensuring they wouldn't blow off in the storm.

meanings.definition: To attach or affix with nails once more.
meanings.sent1: He renailed the sign to the post outside the store.
meanings.sent2: She renailed the loose handle back onto the door.
meanings.sent3: The dog renailed the bone to the ground, trying to hide it from the other pets.
meanings.sent4: The memory renailed itself in his mind, impossible to forget.
meanings.sent5: The artist renailed the canvas to the frame, making sure it was secure for display.
